comments.body:
First, there is tall grass.  I do not see what you are trying to say about it though.

Second, I do not see any tall grass (2 blocks tall) in your png.  There are large quantities of regular grass (1 block tall) in your png.
There is some tall grass (2 blocks tall) near the forest on your right, and there are many tall ferns (2 blocks tall) in the forest ahead.
My screenshots show the correct (Java) behavior. Bedrock has nowhere near this much tall grass.
But all the grass in your snapshot is not tall grass.  All the grass is only one block tall, while tall grass is 2 blocks tall.
No need to be deliberately pedantic
Bedrock actually used to have as much tall grass as Java, but they decided to remove a big portion of it in 0.15 (I believe that's the version, can't confirm but it's around that time frame)

This issue hasn't been touched in some time, but I'd like to try and resurrect it.

The parity problem here, for anyone confused, is that the plains and savanna generation in Bedrock generates a significantly lower amount of tall grass than that of the Java edition. You can see what Java edition looks like in OP's picture.

Here's what Bedrock's generation looks like for context. This screenshot is from 1.14.30 on Windows 10:

As you can see, it's much more barren than what Java is producing.

It's important to note that Bedrock used to have generation with more tall grass! Back during the MCPE days, grass generated like it does on Java. I have no idea why this was changed to what we have now.

I really want to see tall grass improved on Bedrock. When I walk around the plains, it just looks so barren, plain and... wrong for the game.

So, yes, I fully support improving this change and I hope a Mojangster can comment on this topic soon.

Why is this not popular! The bedrock grass plant generation looks NOTHING compared to java. The low amount of taller grass generation on Bedrock just makes the world look barren and dead, especially in biomes such as Savana and Plains. The legacy console edition had the java grass generation, so I do not see why it doesn't exist here on Bedrock.
Now with them phasing out older devices hopefully this goes higher up in their priority list
Mojang definitely needs to fix this!

Yes Mojang needs to take this issue seriously!. It's been a long time since this issue persists and they didn't even take this issue seriously. The Plains and Savannah's in bedrock edition worlds looks barren and lifeless and it isn't giving a natural feeling when playing the game like Java Edition. I hope Deva will soon fix this issueüôÇ.
Bedrock environments look really empty compared to Java because of the lack of tall grass (Talking abot tall grass in general, not just the 3 block ones.
This is just a great idea!!! I would love this to be added in Bedrock. I play both versions and this feature is really useful for playing especially in creative.
Y E S
THIS IS AN WONDERFUL EXCELLENT IDEA
I really need a deeper flat world. I wanna build a super underground metro to my city!!

sweeping edge enchantment would most likely be the best method for adding this feature. 

 

If you want to get a semi-similar effect right now, using a splash potion might be the best bet.
I think if this were to come it would have to come with the combat update, which I think would work well as a world options toggle like the co-ordinates and other things
I wish it was a feature. I have a skeleton spawner and afk at it then I can‚Äôt kill all of them. It needs to be done soon
This, but for each world, as well as achievers for each world, not per account

I think this would be perfect for 1.20. Being able to see how long you‚Äôve been playing in a particular world is part of the story you can tell with it. Instead of using real world dates, you could use ‚Äúin universe‚Äù days for self expression! Or a catalogue of all the mobs you‚Äôve hunted, stored away in one of the new chiseled bookshelves. It‚Äôs perfect for the update!
We also should have so it is faster than it curently is, so minecart are viable again.
Yes it would be greate to make trains or faster minecarts
we should also have the ability to smelt items but have no XP like somebody had mentioned in a previous post and also to connect mine carts with chains
hope it gets added soon to bedrock :)
maybe if minecart furnace acted as a portable furnace? that could be cool I think.
This is a no brainer guys. Useful, and elegant.
It would make transporting villagers so much easier
I voted for this simply because I would like to have a train at a train station that I plan on building in a new world. My son likes trains and currently there‚Äôs no way for me to create one.
Yeah, you have all the reason!
Yes this needs to happen to make explosions satisfying
Yeah the explosions are so ugly on bedrock edition. There is no reason for it to be so ugly
The bedrock raid bar also tells you how many mobs you have remaining at the end phase of every wave. Functionally they are almost the same
I think I posted this in a beta section before that was the case, and it got moved here and fell out of date. Thanks for pointing it out, I edited the post
Yeah it looks so weird being purple, I prefer orange/red
They said this was temporary thing and will be red in the full release but they never did. I guess that's how they keep missing featues so simple but important!
They will add this in 1.18
Addons already have most all of Data Packs' features. It would be redundant.

That is not correct. Behavior packs are missing:

* Advancements

* Block loot tables

* Structures

* Block/item/entity/function tags

Additionally, most of the functionality in good data packs comes from Java's significantly more powerful command system, which is missing in Bedrock.
More than likely, Addon behavior packs will receive the missing features in the future, every few updates, they add more and more features for addon creators.
5 new animals to ride on
I think they should keep the achievements and add advancements.

That sounds like a brilliant idea! Adding on to the idea, maybe the advancements system could be a whole separate system. This would mean that there would be achievements AND there would be advancements. Advancements could give you rewards like Minecoins, free maps, free texture packs, free skin packs and/or free mash-up packs. The reason I thought of that idea was because the ACHIEVEMENTS give you free items and free emotes - so why don't the other prize opportunities go with the advancements?
Hola me justa jugar Minecraft
C√≥mo salgo de la versi√≥n beta
Arkada≈ü ekleyemiyorum

Taking ideas from the comments, the achievements should be connected to your Microsoft account and could be things such as they are now, or could altogether stay the same, whereas advancements would need to be completed in each new world that you create, such as getting stone tools, then iron and diamond gear, and then harder ones like 'Cover me in debris' and beating the dragon. There could also be one for landing an MLG water bucket or killing the dragon in under three minutes from the dragon spawning.

I mean I signed in so I already have Advancements but the Java one is more cooler!

I give this idea a 8/10

Honestly, the advancement system doesn't even have to interact with the marketplace at all (like others have suggested).  Instead, they could be a per-world system that could also be tied to their achievement counterparts if the world settings allowed.

That being said (heavy speculation incoming), I understand that there may be complications surrounding the requirements of the achievement systems in the various environments to not conflict or be mirrored in-game.  If that's the case, then there would have to be something else.

My wife doesn't like to play in the realm I made for the family because it has achievements disabled due to cheats being enabled.  She doesn't regularly chase the achievements, but prefers the option to chase them when she does.  We don't use cheats regularly in the realm, though I like the flexibility to restore somebody's gear if they lose everything, switch to spectator mode (since that's now in this version of the game) to take screenshots of my builds, etc., similar to in Java Edition.  The realm is set up (like most all Bedrock worlds) to only allow admins/moderators to change world settings and run commands, but it still seems like the advancement system (like unto Java Edition) is a decent way to have a per-world goal that players can chase.

An option for this feature might be to add a per-world toggle to disable advancements if that's the desired behavior of that world.  Also would need an advancement screen to view that progress for that world.
Yep, should be there.
Please do it Mojang. It‚Äôs such a simple fix. I have very little coding experience and managed to fix it with a texture pack. Cmon guys.
Mojang just lazy.
This seems like a bug - it'd be really nice if Bedrock/Pocket edition included the full smooth quartz texture. Mojang. Please. Builders will thank you!

Agreed. Water texture is same whether it's frozen ocean or warm.
Please Update the water textures to match with JAVA
No,bedrock already microsoft
Please update on bedrock Cape migration NOW
I really want this cape.
Crazy that this still isn't a thing

I'm against this, entity cramming is one of those unfair deaths in Minecraft that new players might not know about. Same goes for beds and respawn anchors exploding. Entity cramming checks can also introduce lag.

Maybe in the future, we can instead have new auto-kill redstone blocks for farms!
Yes I agree entity craming is something that should be in bedrock edition to help prevent lag if for ever reason there are 44 mobs in one block and it's also great for traps :D

Now that the newest 1.17.30 update has Nerfed trident killers and the looting effect on tridents we Bedrock folks need this more than ever. Since I started becoming more involved with the background of this game rather than just playing it I have heard nothing but talk of parity and the need and desire for it both from the end users and the producers of the game, yet to date we seem further from any sort of parity than ever before.
I know I'm late to this topic but I think it could be very beneficial to have entity cramming with larger mob farms to reduce the risks of lag on the system when things go awry and mobs build up
This would be amazing! Animal farms would be so much more efficient. Lag would also be reduced as you would be unable to spawn tons of mobs in one space. Minecraft please add this!

I super easy food farm is by cramming some cows on a hopper and just feeding them until meat drops in hopper.

I was really disappointed when it didn't work on bedrock and I found out this is a "only Java thing":(
miss entity cramming

Well that explains it, running the latest version of bedrock in a realm server, built a cow crammer and a field, must have had 60 young and old cows in a 1x1 space and they weren't dieing, I broke a bottom block and 20 or so young cows flew all around, then broke the upper block and it was like an explosion of cows! Pretty funny lol
Many players cram chickens in farms, and if that ever comes, it can break egg farms or reduce egg output.
I‚Äôm trying to make a chicken farm using entity cramming and now I now THIS is why it isn‚Äôt working
Legacy Console has entity cramming in the C++ code. All Mojang has to do is copy the code to Bedrock.

Entity cramming should be a feature because it allows multiple farms and people who say it will introduce more lag , i don't think so because entity's pushing around at a time also causes lag but if there were only 44 mobs in a block then there would definitely be less lag.
why not make entity cramming a setting that defaults to off?  then nobody's existing Bedrock farms will break unexpectedly, and those of us who love it on Java Edition can use it on both versions.
I agree, we need some debug options for bedrock edition like hit boxes and light levels... maybe they could be toggled in the in game settings like show coordinates.
The Debug screen would be useful for Reporting Bugs, taking screenshots of coordinates, and much more.
Das wird halt warscheinlich nicht kommen da es ein zu gro√üer Vorteil f√ºr Pc Spieler w√§re.
Yes! But on mobile, you should be able to tap the coordinates and that would open the F3 screen! In console, you should use a button/button combination (more like Java).
Yeah, cos new players won't know about them. They should be visible.
Basically you mean "Redstone" particles that are emitted when the levers are triggered, and YES I would like to see that
Yeah, that tiny look to see "is it really on or off?" flicker of the red *'s makes a difference, but it isn't so obvious it's in your face. I really want that in Bedrock.
Just Fyi, I think this is meant to be tagged as java parity

hey so

(Bedrock Parity)

implies that it's something in bedrock that should be in java or legacy console.
It's already announced. It's one of the first announced feedback you see.
I want the banner shield to be in Pocket Edition
Yeah I also agree with this it‚Äôs bothersome trying to find mods that work so yeah especially for the one on pocket edition
I tried putting a banner on my shield in Minecraft for Windows and it's annoying that they included this feature in Java Edition only, so I agree.
1.5 years after this post.... still not a feature.
Definetly
I've always wanted this on bedrock if they do it on java why not bedrock
Please do this as soon as possible
The fact that 1.11 contains IDs such as stone_slab4 is very strong evidence that this needs to be done very soon.

I don't even understand the commands for bedrock. The command system and block system is very bad, and you almost cant do anything with commands, and there is no /data to check for blockstates. The flattening and better command system is needed for bedrock. Until that is done, I will play on java edition.

Agreed. /give, /fill, /setblock and other commands are a pain to use in Bedrock because you need to constantly reference the Wiki in order to find the data values.

I‚Äôd say Bedrock Edition has more children and teenagers in its demographic. Commands and command blocks are a simple form of coding, and Minecraft is a great opportunity for these users to get familiar with this skill, e.g. how syntax works.

Unfortunately, commands being so unintuitive in Bedrock, a lot of users are discouraged from using them, because they would need to check additional documents while playing. 

Bedrock needs a flattening as soon as possible.

Couldnt agree more. I am a veteran mcpe player (still play on my ipad) that left after mcpe 0.13. I recently came back after the update aquatic and decided to try the commands on mobile. The first two thing I thought were where on earth were the different planks and how do I get a specific spawn egg.

YES! It's hard for me to teach my friends /fill and /setblock when in order to get concrete powder there's no underscore, and when getting something like chiseled quartz, I believe you have to use "quartz_block 1" (I had to look that one up!), and don't even get me STARTED on spawn eggs! The Flattening will encourage others to learn commands better.
Flattening is planned on bedrock, but they havent announced a version

Yes. Please! As someone who played exclusively Bedrock for ages, the command system is so confusing. Bedrock is in desperate need of The Flattening. And soon.

It is so difficult to do simple things like place a log facing a certain direction, and quite often the wiki about it was completely wrong. This needs to be implemented ASAP.
The /gamemode command should no longer accept numeric or abbreviated gamemode values in Bedrock.
I thought this was the main point of witches - they tag along with the illagers and help them during raids. Well, we definitely need that in Bedrock.
great idea
Possible with behaviour packs
Yessss great idea

If you have xbox edition of bedrock ONLY then no it is not possible and this is very limiting and means that you CAN NOT make a custom world like a pvp set up if you ONLY have xbox edition and I have searched and gotten very annoyed at people that say you should spend More money just so you can do that and I also feel that xbox is the most pay to play variety which to me gives you to not purchase xbox edition.

It's a good idea for map creators but maybe put that suggested feature in the Secret Mob Called NPC there model look like villagers but with player design and you can put a message in the NPC Mob so put this in the game this is great for map creators
good idea!
Plz add this minecraft, I am making a map for my friends and would love if this was a feature!
yes please, if you could add this feature it would make so many things so much easier to do on Minecraft
Tynker says Its possible by changing a villagers coding. But when I have tried it doesnt work.

Yeah, this would be awesome. I have been trying to set up a mine with traders, so you can trade what you mine with a villager who will give you in return food or emeralds, but the current villagers make it so that it could only be very specific minerals from caves that could be traded, not things that are more common like cobblestone or iron ore.
The possibilities with this are ENDLESS
Super idee

The Bedrock Editor should allow you to customise villager trades - see this post for more details:

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/32068505468045--Bedrock-Editor-Editing-Mob-Block-NBT
You should also be able to summon them with similar characteristics as you can in Java, like invulnerability, no AI, no sounds, professions, and the same with wandering traders.
I have been trying to make a bedwars map on bedrock. If mojang added this, it would be so helpful!
Yes, please I need this. I‚Äôve been sitting here for six hours. Re-rolling a villager and still haven‚Äôt gotten sharpness five or four once.
Yes! This should been added! I am spending hours making the shop

Although you're adding to the suggestions with Education Edition, don't forget to support these existing threads about tutorial worlds. Clearly great minds think alike!

We want to help everyone have their ideas succeed. Thanks for your contribution.

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360009518591-Tutorial-World-for-Java-Edition

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360009476991-Training-World-for-Bedrock
I agree that it is good idea!!
They could make it into a world template from the get go for any new player and available on the marketplace for free for older players

Yes please, the tutorial worlds 4J has crafted for console editions (especially this last one they got with update Aquatic) are really well-made, fun to explore and full of secrets. I hope they'll make them available for Bedrock players by releasing them on the marketplace
This is a good idea, this might get put in the game.

Blaze
Ghast eyes

Enchanting table
Magma cubes
Drowned

I really like these blocks and mobs glowing in the dark. java edition players should have this experience
I voted!
It's quite odd that we literally have glowing squids and yet the drowned still don't glow.
Yes, but don't make the drowned's head bigger, they're already weirdly big in Java.
I also thought it was a bug since others in a multiplayer world doing the same thing appear with swinging arms while you yourself do not in third-person.
Yes please I have wanted this for ages!
I need this
I know that the developer version has F3 option, and I hope the normal version can also be adjusted
It is also important to add and find a way to put the different functions of f3 such as: f3+q, f3+a, etc.
F3 is cheating and we should NOT be encouraging that on other platforms
That would be awesome
This would be really helpful for Realms and servers on bedrock. Its already implemented in Java, but the switch over to Bedrock would be awesome
Please Minecraft, this would be huge for the bedrock version of the game, it would help me not get lost on my world and spend hours trying to find my base.

Java has it, and it would be perfect for those who play on bedrock and have a large portion of the world explored, so they can go back to marked areas. Please make this a thing, it shouldn‚Äôt even be that hard
Yeah! Saw someone do this on Java and was upset to find out it didn‚Äôt work on bedrock! I want to label the structures and farms on my map! Pls add!
please mojang I've been waiting for this parity of waypoints, and also banners on Shields to come to bedrock, I'm waiting for these features

We got Banners on Shields now on Bedrock for 1.20, so really this is the only parity change we need in terms of Banners that would make it equally as good as it is on Java. Bedrock Team, please add this feature in so that it'll be easier to see all the locations of my Villages, Structures and other Important Points on a Map Wall.
My fun in Minecraft is to explore, build outpost and cartograph the world. Being able to put down banner to mark point of interest on the maps would be AWESOME beyond belief.
